item.title: Ever-expanding animation of the life of the 796th floor of a space station

item.title: Night of the living brain fog dead or how I hacked myself better via open source
item.description: Software engineer Luke Hinds shares his journey in using an open-source approach to tackle his severe sleep apnea, purchasing a Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) machine and utilizing open-source licensed software OSCAR to process the data.

item.title: RePalm
item.description: The article discusses the challenges of creating an unauthorized port of PalmOS, including developing an emulator and kernel for the platform.

item.title: Effective Spaced Repetition
item.description: The article explains the use of spaced repetition for effective memorization and overcoming its limitations.

item.title: The biggest EV battery recycling plant in the US is open for business
item.description: Ascend Elements, a recycling startup in Massachusetts, has opened a recycling plant in Covington, Georgia that is the largest EV battery recycling facility in North America.

item.title: FTX stored private keys to crypto assets in plaintext, without access controls
item.description: FTX, a cryptocurrency derivatives exchange, has been storing private keys to crypto assets in plaintext without access controls, putting its users' assets at risk.

item.title: I fixed a parasitic drain on my car in 408 days
item.description: The author shares his experience fixing a parasitic battery drain on his 2013 Mazda3 hatchback that caused the battery to drain itself in a matter of hours or days over 408 days.

item.title: How To Get Started In Soldering
item.description: N/A

item.title: Hell Never Ends on x86: The Hyperspace Story, Continued, Sort Of
item.description: HP bought Phoenix Hyperspace and integrated it into their products, replacing their fast-boot Linux with a web browser, Skype, email client, and widgets, which was done without any fanfare or announcement.

item.title: Teaching ChatGPT to speak my son's invented language
item.description: Ryszard Szopa and his son used ChatGPT to teach it KÅ‚eti, a language that Rysio created.

item.title: We Need To Talk About Vercel
item.description: Recent discussions about Vercel have brought attention to the development experience value of the CDN product although it has encountered technical deficiencies.

item.title: OpenBSD 7.3
item.description: OpenBSD 7.3 introduces kernel improvements, graphics updates, and enhanced userland features.

item.title: Dashcam footage shows driverless cars clogging San Francisco
item.description: Videos obtained by WIRED show autonomous vehicles operating in San Francisco causing confusion, anxiety, and transit delays, with incidents including self-stranding cars and blocked routes.

item.title: Personal Concierge Using OpenAI's ChatGPT via Telegram & Voice Messages
item.description: A Telegram bot called ChatGPT Concierge uses OpenAI's ChatGPT and Whisper API to generate voice from text and respond to voice messages.

item.title: Al Jaffee, king of the Mad Magazine fold-in, has died
item.description: N/A.

item.title: EditAnything: Segment Anything + ControlNet + BLIP2 + Stable Diffusion
item.description: "Edit Anything" is an ongoing project aimed at image editing and generation, utilizing various technologies.

item.title: Dancing Plague of 1518
item.description: N/A.

item.title: Using RP2040 PIO to drive a poorly-designed displa
item.description: A new driver for the Waveshare 2.8 inch 320x240 full-color LCD display has been released that supports various modes for greyscale, indexed colour, and full color, and retrieves real-time touch data using RP2040 PIO.

item.title: Hacker News Ranking Algorithm
item.description: The author presents an alternative algorithm for ranking posts on HackerNews that utilizes PageRank and incorporates the upvotes of comments made on a user's profile.

item.title: Apple's plunge in PC shipments is steepest among major computer makers
item.description: Apple experienced a 40.5% decline in personal computer shipments this quarter, experiencing the worst drop since Q4 of 2000 due to sluggish demand and an industry-wide glut.

item.title: If you've raised venture capital, you have to pay yourself
item.description: N/A.

item.title: The Kissimmee River has been brought back to life, & wildlife is thriving
item.description: The article reports on the restoration of the Kissimmee River in Florida, which is responsible for much of the water flowing into the Northern Everglades, where Disney World is located.

item.title: Shutting down nuclear power could increase air pollution: study
item.description: A study by MIT shows that closing down nuclear power plants in the US could increase air pollution, causing over 5,000 premature deaths, particularly impacting African American communities living close to fossil fuel plants.

item.title: What I've Learned About Formal Methods in Half a Year
item.description: Jakob L. Kreuze shares his journey to learn about formal methods and their use in software verification.

item.title: Zoomable, animated scatterplots in the browser that scales over a billion points
item.description: The Deep Scatterplots for the Web library allows for the display of an evolving and large number of data points via the web with improved speed due to Apache Arrow's feather format, custom WebGL rendering layers using REGL, and grammar-of-graphics transforms handled on the GPU.

item.title: Ask HN: Open source LLM for commercial use?
item.description: N/A.

item.title: Problems with AWS Amplify & its use of DynamoDB
item.description: An ex-employee criticizes AWS Amplify for its use of DynamoDB, lack of scalability, and limitations with user data access control.

item.title: Xylazine, a dangerous new drug fuelling Canada's opioid crisis
item.description: Xylazine, a powerful sedative typically used on large animals, is a new dangerous substance that has amplified the toxicity of Canada's drug supply, found in 1,350 drug seizures in Ontario and British Columbia.

item.title: Use GitHub Actions to Make Your GitHub Profile Dynamic
item.description: GitHub Actions can transform a static Markdown document into a dynamic profile by scraping data from websites and updating the profile with the latest information using scripts and workflows, as demonstrated in an example using Ruby.
